content:
You're a coffee and tea enthusiast, eh? I'm happy to recommend some excellent tea shops in the downtown area that'll cater to your green tea explorations!

Here are a few tea shops you might enjoy:

1. **Steeped Tea Co.**: This charming tea shop offers an impressive selection of loose-leaf teas, including many green tea varieties. They also have a "Tea of the Month" subscription service, which can help you discover new flavors. (5-minute walk from The Daily Grind)
2. **The Tea Room**: This cozy spot specializes in artisanal teas, including Japanese green teas like Sencha and Gyokuro. They also serve delicious sandwiches, scones, and pastries. (10-minute walk from Brewed Awakening)
3. **Infusion Tea House**: This modern tea shop features a vast selection of teas from around the world, including unique green tea blends. They also offer tea flights and tastings, which can help you refine your brewing skills. (5-minute walk from The Coffee Club)
4. **Tea Topia**: This family-owned tea shop boasts an extensive collection of loose-leaf teas, including many organic and fair-trade options. They also offer tea-pairing workshops and classes. (10-minute walk from Café Vivace)
5. **The Green Tea House**: This serene oasis is dedicated entirely to green tea, with a focus on Japanese and Chinese varieties. They offer tea tastings, brewing classes, and a serene atmosphere perfect for relaxation. (10-minute walk from the Arts District)

These tea shops are all within a 10-15 minute walk from each other, making it easy to explore and find your new favorite spot.

Since you're experimenting with brewing times and temperatures, you might appreciate the expertise of the tea sommeliers at these shops. They can offer valuable insights and tips to help you perfect your green tea brewing skills.

Do you have a preferred atmosphere or specific type of green tea you're interested in exploring (e.g., matcha, sencha, dragonwell)? I can give you more tailored recommendations.
